titleStmt.title: No necessity of reformation of the publick doctrine of the Church of England. By John Pearson, D.D.
titleStmt.author: Pearson, John, 1613-1686.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A53894 of text R202284 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing P1001). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: No necessity of reformation of the publick doctrine of the Church of England. By John Pearson, D.D.
titleStmt.author: Pearson, John, 1613-1686.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.G. for Nathaniel Brook at the Angel in Cornhill,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Burges, Cornelius. Reasons shewing the necessity of reformation.
Running title reads: No necessity of reforming the doctrine of the Church of England.
In this edition the final paragraph on p. 27 begins "And thus having answered ..". Something less than half of the text is wholly or partly in the same setting as the other edition.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

keywords.term: Burges, Cornelius, 1589?-1665. -- Reasons shewing the necessity of reformation.
